thread.title: Erica Jesseman three-peats as Hartford Marathon champion
thread.title_full: Erica Jesseman three-peats as Hartford Marathon champion

title: Erica Jesseman three-peats as Hartford Marathon champion
text:
Erica Jesseman three-peats as Hartford Marathon champion Erica Jesseman three-peats as Hartford Marathon champion Post to Facebook Erica Jesseman three-peats as Hartford Marathon champion Erica Jesseman three-peats as Hartford Marathon champion   wlbz2.com: http://on.wlbz2.com/1LnQorj   Join the Conversation To   Erica Jesseman three-peats as Hartford Marathon champion Jessie Sawyer 12:14 p.m. EDT October 10, 2015 Erica Jesseman finishes as the first Maine women's runner! (Photo: NEWS CENTER) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
HARTFORD, Connecticut (NBC CONNECTICUT) -- A New Britain man won the Eversource Hartford Marathon Saturday and a woman from Maine was the first female to cross the finish line. 
Jonas Hampton, of New Britain, took first place overall. He's the first Hartford area man to win the marathon since 1994, according to race officials. He finished in an unoffical time of 2:15:57 and was in the 25- to 29-year-old division. Hampton used to run competitively at the Unversity of Hartford, according to race officials. 
Matt Pelletier, of Oneco, Connecticut, who won the marathon last year when he was a resident of Rhode Island, placed second, finishing with an unofficial time of 2:17:57, race officials said. 
Meanwhile, Erica Jesseman, of Scarbourough, Maine was the first woman to finish the marathon, coming in 19th place overall. It was her first year to come in first for women. She was in the 25- to 29-year-old category, clocking an unofficial time of 2:41:41. 
Thousands of runners from all over were expected. 
In addition to the marathon, there was a half marathon, 5K and marathon relay. 
See the full unofficial race results on the Hartford Marathon Foundation website . Read or Share this story: http://on.wlbz2.com/1LnQorj TOP VIDEOS
